previous_statement: PRIMITIVITY CRITERION (Lemma 10): By Lemma 10, for a transitive group G on set X: G is primitive if and only if G preserves no non-trivial partition of X. Since H is transitive on Omega (established in node 1.1 via Lemma 5) and H preserves no non-trivial partition of Omega (established in node 1.2 via Lemma 11.5), we conclude by Lemma 10 implication (2) => (1) that H acts primitively on Omega. QED.
new_statement: PRIMITIVITY CRITERION (Lemma 10): By Lemma 10, for a transitive group G on set X: G is primitive if and only if G preserves no non-trivial partition of X. Since H is transitive on Omega (established in node 1.2 via Lemma 5) and H preserves no non-trivial partition of Omega (established in node 1.3 via Lemma 11.5), we conclude by Lemma 10 implication (2) => (1) that H acts primitively on Omega. QED.
